job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Livonia, MI
pros: Coworkers including ancillary staff are very friendly and helpful to one another, great teamwork. Received good increase in hourly wage per year. Management seems to really care about staff. Great nurse to patient ratios. Never went over 5 patients on day shift for med/surg, occasionally had 4 even.
cons: Focus is so much on patient satisfaction, yet RNs are harped on constantly to have their charting perfected as well as following floor protocols that often take away from direct patient care. Patient satisfaction is such a focus at all costs that RNs often are not able to stand up to rude patients/family members and we are often giving in to patients that are being unreasonable. High expectations are set upon RNs who are doing their best, yet physicians often get off with providing subpar care and not communicating with patients and it then reflects back onto nurses as the reason patients are not satisfied (that and patients often complain about the food and are upset about that). RNs are responsible for making sure order sets are completed, even though many of these order sets involve orders for labs/diagnostics that should be the physicians responsibility in placing and often go not placed.

pros:
The hospital DOES give great care to the community, and the staff and leaders always have good intentions. Also, the executive team is new and have a lot on their plate with current condition of the hospital and trying to modernize their management systems. However, the bad experiences far outweigh the good. 

Also, great benefits.
cons:
The CEO has been witnessed many times sleeping at meetings, which I think it’s the perfect metaphor for the organization itself- languid.
 
Leaders are almost always promoted without any leadership experience, and they receive no training for their role themselves, which creates systemically poor leadership and lack of support from executives down to front line. Because of this, many individuals in leadership are waiting out retirement, the others are leaving the organization at a dramatic rate.
 
The hospital has little control over the private physicians so it is very difficult to involve them in necessary business operations meetings. The physicians at department meetings, whom are supposed to be leaders, regularly scream at each other like they are the Real Housewives of OC. Other meetings that involve the departments, physicians, and ancillary staff are often found more focused on blaming each other for problems rather than solving the problems themselves.
 
Lastly, the transfer from Cerner to Epic in 2020 was rushed and built entirely incorrect, leaving front line staff confused and without many resources needed in the midst of the COVID pandemic, which hit the hospital badly in the early months.

review_title: Horrible management & poor dietary office service
job_title: Food and Nutrition Food Service Worker in Livonia, MI
pros: Meeting different patients everyday, getting to talk with the nurses
cons: Bad scheduling, rude boss, unorganized department. When following proper protocol in regards to patients food, if something is in correct, we, the food service workers would have to go  back to the kitchen and speak with the dietary department regardless of who is in the room during such time and tell them this patients order is incorrect, they ordered this meal not a house tray. Would get really rude remarks from the office saying I'm not giving them that order, they are receiving a house tray. Or why are you sending us ticket orders from patients when they just received a tray. It would happen every single day with the dietary department and the boss would do nothing to fix the problem. Also, the dietary department never cancels patients orders  if the patient is being discharged for that day, for example, if the patient is there for breakfast but leaves before lunch time , we, the food service workers would tell the dietary department this room number has been discharged, please cancel their meal order for lunch and dinner. When the time comes for lunch and dinner, we would still get that patients tray to be delivered even when the food service worker already tells the dietary department theyve been discharged why are you still sending those rooms food trays?

review_title: I feel that this company cares more about how it appear than how happy any of the employees are.
pros: They have a brand new tower with all private rooms that makes doing your job much easier. There is a large employee parking lot so nobody has to pay for parking or take a shuttle to and from your car.
cons: For the past 5 years we have not received raises and the one raise we did get was around 35 cents. They spend money on wasteful products such as our new "hourly rounding" sheets that I have personally witnessed being tossed in the trash by the hundreds. The decision makers for this hospital make all of these changes but never once talk to an employee to get any knowledge that would actually benefit our job in any way. There is no job security at this hospital in any way, any employee could be let go at any time and there is nothing they could do about it. On average most nurses have 6 patients when they arrive and I have seen it go up to 7 on more than one occasion. That many patients causes a lot of stress on staff and is very unsafe from a nursing stand point.
